meanings.definition: To be the host of an event or gathering.
meanings.sent1: She hosted a birthday party for her friend.
meanings.sent2: The school hosted a talent show last week.
meanings.sent3: The cat hosted a tea party for the birds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sun hosted a dazzling light show in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tree hosted a gathering of squirrels and birds in its branches.

meanings.sent1: The hotel hosted the wedding guests in luxurious rooms.
meanings.sent2: Our home hosted relatives during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The tent hosted a surprise party for the campers inside.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hosted a spectacular lightning show for the storm.
meanings.sent5: The cave hosted a family of bats seeking shelter from the rain.

meanings.definition: To store a website or data on a server.
meanings.sent1: The company hosted their website on a secure server.
meanings.sent2: The university hosted the research data on a dedicated server.
meanings.sent3: The cloud hosted a virtual dance party for the digital files.
meanings.sent4: The library hosted a vast collection of knowledge on its servers.
meanings.sent5: The computer hosted a treasure trove of information in its memory.
